headline.print_headline: Simpler Labels For Food Content Proposed
headline.main: Simpler Labels for Food Content Proposed

docs.lead_paragraph: The European Commission proposed simpler food labels highlighting fat, sugar and salt content in an effort to contain the spread of obesity and junk food. Under the proposals, six content elements will have to appear on packages: energy, total fat, saturated fat, carbohydrates, sugar and salts. The labels will indicate what percentage of advisable daily intake they represent. “Consumers have to be able to make the right choice. They need the right information to plan their diet,” the health commissioner Markos Kyprianou, above, said. The proposals exclude beer, wine and spirits. They will now be taken up by the European Parliament and must be approved by member nations.
